text.section: If a retail sale of tangible personal property or a taxable service is made through a vending or other self-service machine, the sales and use tax rate is 6%, applied to 94.5% of the gross receipts from the vending machine sales.

section.section:
In this subsection:
"short-term vehicle rental" means a rental of a passenger car, as defined in § 11-144.1 of the Transportation Article, or a vehicle that may be registered as a Class E, F, G, or M vehicle under Title 13, Subtitle 9 of the Transportation Article, for a period of 180 days or less under the following terms:
the vendor does not provide a driver for the vehicle as a part of the rental; and
if the vehicle is a passenger car, as defined in § 11-144.1 of the Transportation Article, or a multipurpose passenger vehicle, the vehicle is not to be used to transport individuals or property for hire; and
"short-term vehicle rental" does not include a rental of:
a dump truck, as described in § 13-919 of the Transportation Article;
a tow truck, as described in § 13-920 of the Transportation Article; or
a farm vehicle exempt from the sales and use tax under § 11-201(a) of this title.

text.section: The sales and use tax rate for the first retail sale of a manufactured home, as defined in § 12-301(g) of the Public Safety Article, is the rate imposed under subsection (a) of this section applied to 60% of the taxable price.
The rate of the hotel surcharge imposed under § 11-102(b) of this subtitle is 2.5% of the taxable price.

section.section: The sales and use tax rate for the sale of a modular building is the rate imposed under subsection (a) of this section applied to 60% of the taxable price.

text.section:
The sales and use tax rate for the sale of an alcoholic beverage, as defined in § 5-101 of this article, is:
9% of the charge for the alcoholic beverage; and
6% of a charge that is made in connection with the sale of an alcoholic beverage and is stated as a separate item of the consideration and made known to the buyer at the time of sale for:
any labor or service rendered;
any material used; or
any property sold.

section.section: In this subsection the following words have the meanings indicated.
"Dyed diesel fuel" means diesel fuel that is dyed under U.S. Environmental Protection Agency rules for high sulfur diesel fuel or is dyed under Internal Revenue Service rules for nontaxable use.
"Marina" means a person who maintains a place of business where motor fuel is sold primarily to vessels.
If a retail sale of dyed diesel fuel is made by a marina, the sales and use tax rate is 6%, applied to 94.5% of the gross receipts from the dyed diesel fuel sales.

text.section: The sales and use tax rate for a mandatory gratuity or service charge in the nature of a tip for serving food or any type of beverage to a group of more than 10 individuals is 6%.
